page.title: 01Area.Blaby/G.Parva/S.Wigston
page.content: Southwest of Leicester is mainly suburban in character with a northerly and eastern urban fringe and a rural fringe south and west.Central east is residential/industrial development.The area is reasonably prosperous but unemployment is high on the council estates nearer Leicester.A variety of commercial and industrial enterprises are scattered throughout the area, although many people travel to the city and beyond for employment. North and east, council housing predominates whilst in the Blaby and Glen Parva areas, owner occupied semi-detached houses are more typical. There are good sports and leisure facilities either within the area or very accessible. The amenities of Leicester are close at hand.The motorway and a good road system give easy access to other regions of the country.
